text: Catholic families around the world have
been waiting eagerly to hear what the
Pope says and how he responds to the
reality of divorce and the modern family
Laura is a writer and the mother of two
children she and her partner Brendan
could not take communion until his first
marriage was annulled by the church now
they plan to marry the church is
teaching is that marriage is for life it
really is a beautiful teaching and I
don't want to see that change but I
think I hope that's that yeah people
priests Cardinals will just be gentler
and and sit with people in the reality
of their situations in the long awaited
document released at a press conference
in Rome today Pope Francis has not
changed Catholic doctrine or teaching
but he has stressed that it must be
applied with mercy and greater
understanding
the Holy Father clearly affirms the
doctrine on marriage and the family is
an indispensable ideal in order to avoid
any erroneous interpretations remember
that in no way should the church
renounce proposing the full ideal of
marriage which is God's plan in all its
grandeur
however the Pope also suggests that
doctrine should be interpreted according
to the customs and culture of each
country opening the door to some priests
offering communion to the divorced and
civilly remarried after looking at their
individual circumstances Holy Communion
the Pope makes clear is not a prize for
the perfect that is what he calls a
powerful medicine a nourishment for the
weak the emphasis here from Pope Francis
is on a church that understands more and
condemns less and offers welcome and
mercy to its flock however frail his
document has been claimed already as a
victory by both conservatives and
liberals
although gay Catholics will be
disappointed that there's no change in
the Church's stance towards same-sex
relationships and marriage
